citation.article-title: Desulfurella kamchatkensis sp. nov. and Desulfurella propionica sp. nov., new sulfur-respiring thermophilic bacteria from Kamchatka thermal environments.

p.s: Desulfurella propionica (pro.pi.o'ni.ca. N.L. fem. adj. propionica propionate-utilizing)
Cells are short rods, single or in pairs, non-motile with multiple pilus-like structures.
Moderate thermophile growing between 33 and 63 °C, with an optimum of 55 °C; neutrophile with a pH optimum of 6.9-7.2.
Growth substrates: H2/CO2, acetate, propionate, pyruvate, lactate, fumarate, malate, palmitate, stearate.
Does not utilize glucose, sucrose, starch, peptone, yeast extract, formate, benzoate, hexadecane, succinate, ethanol, methanol.
Electron acceptors: elemental sulfur and thiosulfate which are reduced to H2S.
All substrates are oxidized to CO2.
Able to grow on pyruvate in the absence of sulfur.
Habitat: continental hot springs rich in elemental sulfur and organics.
Source of isolation: cyanobacterial mat from sulfide-rich hot pond, Uzon caldera, Kamchatka.
